DataElement.preferredName: Opportunistic Infection Susceptibility Disease Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there is a history of opportunistic and predisposing disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Opportunistic Infection Susceptibility Disease Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to personal medical history (the reporting of medical events) of opportunistic infection (an infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression) and predisposing (susceptibility; the constitutional or inborn state disposing to a disease or group of diseases) disease (a definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Opportunistic Infection Susceptibility Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression.:The constitutional or inborn state disposing to a disease, group of diseases, or metabolic or structural anomaly.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Infection caused by an organism that is capable of causing disease in immunocompromised patients only (e.g. HIV-positive or transplanted patients).--2004
The constitutional or inborn state disposing to a disease, group of diseases, or metabolic or structural anomaly.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: use of personal medical history as a variable in an epidemiologic study

Concepts.definition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
